alert.note: Alert for Gogebic; Ontonagon (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Gogebic and western Ontonagon Counties through 430 PM EDT/330 PM CDT/... At 359 PM EDT/259 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bessemer to near Wakefield. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Gogebic and western Ontonagon Counties, including the following locations... Thomaston, Copper Peak, Clark Lake and Black River Harbor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
